page.title: 04STOER PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {STOER SCHOOL}was built in{1896 beside Loch Neil Bhain.All children from Clachtoll, Stoer, Balchladich, Raffin, Culkein, Achnacarnin and Clashnessie would attend STOER SCHOOL. Before that there were another two schools in use,one at{Stoer Lodge}and another at the old{Post Office}in Achnacarnin. The School is 31 m long by 14m wide, there were four classrooms which were filled by over 100 children from the age of 6 to 14. What is now our classroom, toilets, corridor and office used to be one large classroom. Toilets were outside at the back of the school . The pupils had to bring their own lunch but were given a drink of cocoa in the winter months.All the teachers went home at lunch-time leaving the children to their own devices.
